ğŸ“Œ Weâ€™re delighted to welcome you to our beautiful property, located near a body of water. To ensure a comfortable stay, we conduct weekly pest control to minimize the presence of no-see-ums, mosquitoes, and other insects. However, please note that being near water means there is a higher chance of encountering wildlife, including alligators, which can be found in any freshwater area in Florida. While this is part of the natural charm of the area, we encourage guests to enjoy the surroundings responsibly. Your comfort and safety are always our priority!

Video recording devices only monitor the exterior of the home and not any of the interior or swimming/hot tub areas.

ğŸ“Canyon Lake Marina â€“ 3 miles
 If youâ€™re looking to spend the day on the water, Canyon Lake Marina is just a few minutes away. Rent a boat, jet ski, or paddleboard for a day of adventure on the lake. Thereâ€™s also a restaurant offering delicious meals and drinks with a beautiful lakeside view. Whether you're boating, fishing, or just enjoying the scenic beauty, the marina offers a full range of lake activities.
ğŸ“The Heritage Museum of the Texas Hill Country â€“ 4 miles
 Step back in time and discover the rich history of the Texas Hill Country at this fascinating museum. Explore exhibits that showcase everything from dinosaur tracks to Native American artifacts. This family-friendly spot is a great way to spend a couple of hours learning about the regionâ€™s history and natural wonders.
ğŸ“Canyon Lake Gorge â€“ 5 miles
 For an unforgettable experience, take a guided tour of Canyon Lake Gorge. This natural geological formation is home to striking rock formations, fossilized dinosaur footprints, and a unique ecosystem. The tours provide an in-depth look at the history and geology of the area and are a must-see for nature enthusiasts.
ğŸ“Guadalupe River State Park â€“ 15 miles
 For those who enjoy outdoor recreation, Guadalupe River State Park is a fantastic destination. Here, you can hike scenic trails, fish, swim, or tube in the Guadalupe River. The park also features picnic areas, making it ideal for a family outing or a day spent reconnecting with nature.
ğŸ“Natural Bridge Caverns â€“ 20 miles
 Venture underground and explore the Natural Bridge Caverns, one of Texas' most stunning natural wonders. With guided tours showcasing impressive stalactites, stalagmites, and other spectacular formations, itâ€™s an awe-inspiring experience. For thrill-seekers, there are also adventure tours that take you into more rugged, less explored parts of the caverns.
ğŸ“Schlitterbahn Waterpark Resort â€“ 25 miles
 For family-friendly fun, Schlitterbahn Waterpark Resort in New Braunfels is the place to be. This massive waterpark offers a range of thrilling slides, lazy rivers, and wave pools, ensuring hours of fun for all ages. It's a perfect day trip for those looking to cool off and have an exciting time.
ğŸ“Gruene Historic District â€“ 30 miles
 Travel to the charming town of Gruene and explore its historic district, known for its picturesque streets, boutique shops, and delicious restaurants. Donâ€™t miss the iconic Gruene Hall, Texasâ€™ oldest dance hall, where you can enjoy live music and dance the night away. Gruene is a delightful place to immerse yourself in local culture and history.

This 6,000 sqft estate has 6 king beds, 6 full baths, 2 half baths, and additional sleeping accommodations. The property is also near local vineyards like Winding Road Cellars and Philip Carter Winery of Virginia! Where else can you sleep your entire group, enjoy the day at Shenandoah National Park, then come home to take a swim in your heated pool?

ğŸ‘‰ A unique adventure begins at this villa in Hume! The original part of the home, 'Barbee's Tavern,' was built before the Civil War and was used as headquarters for the Union and Confederate armies. Today, it's a vacation rental equipped with modern luxuries like a seasonal saltwater pool. The villa has 6 king beds, 6 full baths, 2 half baths, and additional sleeping accommodations. The vacation home near wineries and local vineyards, is endorsed and supported by Winding Road Cellars and Philip Carter Winery of Virginia! Whether you love fishing, hunting, hiking, horseback riding, golf tournaments, this is the perfect inn to host your entire group.

ğŸ“Art Institute of Chicago â€“ A 19-minute walk to one of the oldest and largest art museums in the U.S., featuring works by artists like Picasso, Van Gogh, and Grant Wood.

name: Farrington Legacy Ranch
description:
Get a small glimpse of the extraordinary scenery of Texas at our inviting ranch home. With large trees to nap under, a peaceful breeze to listen to as it whispers through the trees, and a porch as big as Texansâ€™ hearts, the Farrington Farmhouse is sure to bring you serenity! You can watch the livestock roam, sip coffee on the porch swing, or catch up on your favorite shows with our Smart TV. ğŸŒŸ Come kick off your boots and stay a while! The sun rises and sets over a pasture of cows in the same spectacular way you see in the movies or hear written about in a country song. Only difference this time is, itâ€™s realâ€”and you can soak it in while sipping coffee or tea from the coffee bar, swinging to the good morning crow of the roosters. Once the sun is up, you have a kitchen full of appliances, utensils, dry goods, and spices to fix every meal. There is room for everyone around the tables and plenty of serving space. Smart TVs are in both living rooms to promote family time (Disney+, Netflix, Peacock, and Amazon Prime are provided). Or find just the right game in the playroom. Even better, set up Foursquare volleyball, bags (corn hole), or frisbee outside. When itâ€™s time to start winding down the evening, light a fire in the fire pit for everyone to sit around. As the sun sets, be on the lookout for the moon and stars to bring your day full circle, experience a day like you see in a western movie, out at the Farrington Ranch.

ğŸ“Washington-on-the-Brazos State Historic Site - a major historical site. It includes Independence Hall, the Star of the Republic Museum, and the Barrington Living History Farm. Great for learning about Texas history.
ğŸ“Threshold Vineyards - winery nearby for wine tastings, live music events etc. Proximity is good.

ğŸ“BeeWeaver Honey Farm & Wildflyer Mead Company - Agritourism / Bee farm / Honey tasting. Behind-the-scenes beekeeping, sampling honey. If you like nature and tasting local honey or mead, this is fun. Tours, tastings, gift shop.

ğŸ“Local Attractions in Pietramelara

Borgo Medievale di Pietramelara - Wander through the picturesque medieval village with its winding stone pathways and historic architecture, leading up to commanding views from the hilltop.

Chiesa di San Rocco - A 16th-century church built atop an earlier chapel, celebrated for its elaborately carved wooden portal, a 1700s wooden statue of San Rocco, and remarkable frescoes.

Chiesa dellâ€™Annunziata - A Baroque-style church housing an onyx altar and a refined Annunciation artwork, with frescoes in the apse dome attributed to the Giorgione schoolâ€”recognized as a national monument.

Convento degli Agostiniani (now Town Hall) - This former Augustinian convent dates back to the 13th century and features a cloister you can access through the adjacent Church of Santâ€™Agostino.

Convento di San Pasquale - Admire the well-preserved monastic cells set around a square cloister and its lovely gardenâ€”they can also be visited with authorization from the municipality.

Grotte di Seiano - Explore the subterranean network of ancient galleries carved into the slopes of Monte Maggioreâ€”an intriguing archaeological feature of Pietramelara.

ğŸ“Outdoor & Cultural Excursions Nearby

Eremi di Fradejanne e di San Salvatore (Monte Maggiore) - A moderate ~3 km hiking route, about 1 hour 20 minutes round-trip, that brings you to hermitages nestled in scenic mountain terrain.

Via Francigena Sud: Teano â€“ Roccaromana Trail - A longer hiking route (~22.5 km, ~6 h), ideal for those seeking extended, immersive nature walks through historic landscapes.

ğŸ“Surrounding Area Highlights (within ~20 km)

Oasis Le Salicelle (Volturno River Wetlands) - A lush riparian habitat teeming with birdlifeâ€”perfect for peaceful nature walks and birdwatching.

Campanian Amphitheater (Santa Maria Capua Vetere) - A remarkable ancient Roman amphitheater, second only in size to the Colosseumâ€”rich in history and ideal for archaeology enthusiasts.

Belvedere di San Leucio (Caserta) - A royal complex and former silk-production hub offering sweeping views over Caserta and its surroundings.

Escape to this beautiful mountain retreat in Ceiba, offering breathtaking views of El Yunque and a peaceful stay surrounded by nature. Ideal for families or groups, this fully air-conditioned home is perfect for relaxation, adventure and exploring Puerto Ricoâ€™s natural beauty. Escape to Rainforest House, a modern 8-unit condo building nestled between the El Yunque Rainforest and the Caribbean Sea. Perfectly located near Fajardo, Humacao, and Ceiba, this property offers convenient access to Puerto Ricoâ€™s most iconic destinations, including the islands of Culebra, Vieques, Palomino, Culebrita, and Icacos.

Each condo is designed for comfort and style, making Rainforest House Puerto Rico an ideal choice for families, couples, or groups seeking a luxury vacation rental. Enjoy easy day trips to Icacos for snorkeling, Vieques for its bioluminescent bay, or Culebraâ€™s Flamenco Beach, consistently ranked among the worldâ€™s best beaches.

Guests love that weâ€™re just minutes from the Ceiba ferry terminal and the Fajardo marinas, where tours depart daily for island-hopping, sailing, and diving. Back on land, immerse yourself in the lush trails and waterfalls of El Yunque National Rainforest, only a short drive away.

â­ ACTIVITIES/ATTRACTIONS â­
Get ready for endless fun and excitement! From outdoor adventures to unique local attractions, there's always something to explore nearby. Whether you're into shopping, dining, or soaking up the local culture, youâ€™ll find plenty of ways to make your stay unforgettable!

ğŸ“Condado Beach - popular beach for sunbathing, swimming, and people-watching. Great place to relax.
ğŸ“La Ventana al Mar (The Window to the Sea) - a public oceanfront park on Ashford Avenue. Nice for walking, relaxing, enjoying ocean views, and the sea breeze.
ğŸ“Condado Lagoon (Laguna del Condado) - offers calm waters compared to the ocean, so good for kayaking, paddleboarding, or an evening float under stars.
ğŸ“Playita del Condado (Condado Bridge Beach) - a smaller beach at the end of Ashford, good if you want something less crowded, and to enjoy water views.
ğŸ“Walking / Strolling Ashford Avenue - the avenue itself is full of shops, restaurants, and cafes. Pleasant for strolling, enjoying the architecture, and shopping.
ğŸ“Old San Juan - a short drive or ride away. For history, architecture, forts (El Morro, Castillo San CristÃ³bal), cobblestone streets, colorful buildings, plazas, and museums.
ğŸ“Museos de Arte & Culture - for example, the Museo de Arte de Puerto Rico (in Santurce), and museums in Old San Juan.
ğŸ“Wildlife / Nature Museum - Museo de Vida Silvestre (Wildlife Museum) is in San Juan; it has many specimens and educational exhibits.

Perfect for business or leisure. Enjoy a modern stay in the heart of downtown Atlanta. Book now!

 - Bed: 1 Queen-Size Mattress

- Free Parking: This unit has a permit for guests to stay. The permit is sent in the Messenger app to print and must be viewable on the dashboard of the guest vehicle. 

This unit is located right next to a highly rated 5-star restaurant and nightclubâ€”One Street Overâ€”conveniently situated in the same building, just 10 feet from your front door. Relax and enjoy one of Atlantaâ€™s premier spot without ever leaving the block.
___________________

Additional Guests Policy: 

The nightly rate includes up to 3 guests. This unit has a strict maximum occupancy of 5 guests. To accommodate additional guests, we provide an inflatable mattress in the unit. There is an additional fee per guest beyond the included 3 to help cover extra housekeeping and linen use.
Since this is a one-bedroom unit, we kindly ask that it be kept tidy when hosting more than 3 guests. Excessive mess will result in an additional cleaning fee. Please note: Occupancy of more than 5 guests violates our house rules and will be treated according to our undeclared guest policy.

Pets Policy:

Weâ€™re happy to welcome small pets (30 lbs or less) with a pet fee. To help us keep the space fresh for everyone, we also ask for a $250 refundable deposit for housekeeping and potential pet-related damage. Just a couple of favorsâ€”we kindly ask that pets stay off the furniture and that our linens arenâ€™t used for cleaning up or bathing them. Thanks so much for understanding!

___________________

Shared Amenities & Local Perks:

While the building itself is private, guests are welcome to request exclusive add-ons through our Ã€ La Carte Services, including:

- Day passes to luxury pools or lounges at nearby hotels like Twelve Midtown, W Atlanta, The Starling, and more
- Event or Romantic Decor Setup - Give your significant other a time to remember.
Bike or scooter rentals
- Private Chef Experience â€“ Gourmet meals prepared in-suite
- Personal Driver / Chauffeur â€“ For city tours or airport pickups
- In-Room Massage & Yoga â€“ Relax and recharge with private wellness sessions
- Grocery Pre-Stocking â€“ Walk into a fully stocked kitchen
- Special Event Setup â€“ Celebrate birthdays, anniversaries, or proposals

Please inquire about availability after bookingâ€”these services are offered on a first-come, first-served basis and can be ordered through our app when you arrive or ahead of your visit by direct request via the platform app.

Guests will be given a code to enter the building and rental unit at the time of booking in the welcome letter, and a reminder message sent to the guest 60 minutes before the 4 PM check-in time.

We are always available. Please reach out to us on the booking platform app.

BACKDOOR ACCESS: We ask that you donâ€™t use the door in the back of the unit as it will trip an alarm. It is for emergencies ONLY.

SOUND: There is an upscale nightclub next door.  Sound is low-level base, but no voices. The lounge is open from Fri-Sun 12 PM - 3 AM, and noise doesn't start until dark. If you are sound sensitive, please consider this before booking.

FRONT DOOR:  If the door gives you a hard time locking or unlocking:

- Gently pull the door toward you while turning the lock.
- Sometimes the door shifts slightly in the frame, and this will help the mechanism align properly.

TOILET:  For a full flush, please hold down the flush handle for at least 10 seconds. This ensures everything clears completely and prevents clogs.

SHORT-TERM EXTENSION TO A MONTH: For any guest booking with an initial duration of less than one month, if the guest wishes to extend their stay beyond one month, the Host requires the creation of a new booking rather than altering the existing reservation. Each subsequent monthly extension will also require a new booking. Guests extending their stay beyond one month must also schedule a housekeeping visit within the first week of each new monthly booking.

MID-TERM EXTENSIONS: For bookings exceeding 35 nights, a mid-stay cleaning fee will be applied and collected through the platform resolution center monthly. This is necessary to maintain the property in the advertised condition. The mid-stay cleaning includes housekeeping for all the bedrooms, bathrooms, kitchen, and living room. Host-provided color linens are the guests' responsibility to launder, but our team will make the beds if the linens have been washed before our housekeeping team's arrival. The cleaning can be scheduled at your convenience, and your presence is not required for it to take place.

Lux Experience Corp conducts regular pest control treatments, but this doesnâ€™t eliminate the possibility of them entering the property.
